His parents were Christian,Christian, Professor of PhysiologyProfessor of Physiology at Copenhagen University,at Copenhagen University, andand Ellen Bohr. He had a youngerEllen Bohr. What DiD he Do?What DiD he Do?  He attended Gammelholm Grammar School in 1903, and entered CopenhagenHe attended Gammelholm Grammar School in 1903, and entered Copenhagen University where took his Master's degree in Physics in 1909 and his Doctor's degreeUniversity where took his Master's degree in Physics in 1909 and his Doctor's degree in 1911.in 1911.  Niels Bohr was President of the Royal Danish Academy of Sciences, of the DanishNiels Bohr was President of the Royal Danish Academy of Sciences, of the Danish Cancer Committee, and Chairman of the Danish Atomic Energy Commission. He wasCancer Committee, and Chairman of the Danish Atomic Energy Commission. He was a Foreign Member of the Royal Society (London), the Royal Institution.a Foreign Member of the Royal Society (London), the Royal Institution.  He held a Lectureship for Physics at Copenhagen University and Victoria Univeristy inHe held a Lectureship for Physics at Copenhagen University and Victoria Univeristy in Manchester. Appointed Professor of Theoretical Physics at Copenhagen University,Manchester. Appointed Professor of Theoretical Physics at Copenhagen University, and in 1920 he became head of the institute for Theoretical Physics.and in 1920 he became head of the institute for Theoretical Physics.

With this theory, other scientists used this to understamdnucleus. With this theory, other scientists used this to understamd nuclear fission better.nuclear fission better.  He carried out a theoretical piece of work on the absorption of alphaHe carried out a theoretical piece of work on the absorption of alpha rays which was published in therays which was published in the Philosophical MagazinePhilosophical Magazine, 1913., 1913.  He created the consitution of atomic nuclei.He created the consitution of atomic nuclei.
